Justification: To assess the overall function of the liver and identify any abnormalities in liver enzymes, bilirubin levels, and other markers.
To check for signs of infection, anemia, or other hematological issues that may be contributing to the symptoms.
To rule out viral hepatitis as a potential cause of jaundice.
To visualize the liver, gallbladder, and bile ducts for any structural abnormalities, obstructions, or lesions.
To evaluate the blood's ability to clot, which can be affected by liver function.
To determine the type of jaundice (pre-hepatic, hepatic, or post-hepatic) based on bilirubin levels.

Investigation: Liver imaging (CT or MRI if indicated)
Justification: To further investigate any abnormalities found on ultrasound or to assess for liver masses or tumors if clinically indicated.
